date: stated on September 2, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, Kevin Hart wasn't "crippled from the neck down," he didn't hit the vocal cords in a car accident.
text: The comedian Kevin Hart was involved in a serious car accident in the early hours of September when he was in the car he was riding. According to reports, Hart and the driver were hit by "big back injuries," while another passenger was slightly injured. But the Facebook article shared a day after the accident that Hart's injuries were much worse, claiming that he was " paralyzed from the neck down" and that he was also "sonic cord paralyzed," leaving him speechless. This is the article, in its entirety: "It is deeply regrettable to announce that Kevin Hart has been paralyzed from the neck down and his vocal cords have also been paralyzed, leaving him speechless. On Sunday morning, he and two others were involved in the Sek incident on Mulholland Highway, which left the old Kevin Hart Plymouth Barcuda's car broken down in a trench. We ask fans at this time to respect Hart's family's desire for privacy, working with medical professionals. "The statement is full of linguistic errors - the first sign not taken from the launch of a project. It was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) Hart reportedly had a long way to go to recover from his effects, but he and his vocal cords were not paralyzed. On January 10, 2021, an article on Facebook says that Nancy Belusi sent a letter to the mayor of Portland after demonstrations there, "Forcing him to abide by a proven democratic playbook." By Sira O'Rourke on January 11, 2021, according to several news reports, Hart suffered three fractures in the spine and underwent surgery after the accident but suffered no paralysis, nerve damage or anesthesia. While Hart has a long recovery, it's said he's already walking, his wife, Eniko Parrish, told TMZ he was awake and "will be fine." The article appears to have arisen from a story on LFR Solutions, a website known for creating fake celebrity stories. The story says that according to "medical sources at the Medical Center of the University of California" Hart, the nerve trauma in his spine and throat left him paralyzed from the neck down. In addition to being diagnosed with quadruple infection, he also suffered a trauma to his neck, causing irreparable damage to the throat, leaving both vocal cords crippled." The Facebook statement is then attributed to an unnamed representative of Hart.
